definition: to melt/to thaw/to defrost/fig. to relax (repression, enmity etc)
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: It takes the microwave time to warm up your dinner enough to unfreeze it.
sentences.chinese: 微波爐需要花一點時間才能將溫度調到足夠解凍它。

sentences.english: Look at the stuff that you'd find when you don't defrost for a couple of billion years.
sentences.chinese: 看看那些東西，如果幾億年不解凍，你就會發現它們。

sentences.english: Take the beef out of the refrigerator to defrost.
sentences.chinese: 把牛肉從冰箱裏拿出來解凍。

sentences.english: Exhumations are to begin when the ground thaws, probably in March.
sentences.chinese: 掘墓工作很可能在三月份土地解凍時開始。

sentences.english: Thaw tofu, squeeze out water, cut into large cubes.
sentences.chinese: 把冰硬豆腐解凍，逼出水份，切件。

sentences.english: The chilly relations between them are beginning to thaw out.
sentences.chinese: 他們之間的冷淡關係正開始解凍。

sentences.english: Before transplantation, the graft is thawed and rehydrated.
sentences.chinese: 移植前，移植物的解凍和再水化。

sentences.english: The article discusses the unfreezing method improvement and its advantages and disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 本文就解凍方法的改進及利弊進行探討。

sentences.english: Completely defrost meat and poultry before grilling so it cooks more evenly.
sentences.chinese: 燒烤之前把豬肉和禽肉充分解凍可以使其烤得更均勻。

sentences.english: The warm weather unfroze the ground early.
sentences.chinese: 暖和的天氣使大地提早解凍。

sentences.english: Defrost cuttlefish ball and grill or barbecue till cooked and serve.
sentences.chinese: 燒烤解凍後墨魚丸直到熟爲止。

sentences.english: The frozen chicken thawed out half an hour later.
Frozen products should show no signs of thawing.
sentences.chinese: 冷凍產品應顯示沒有解凍的跡象。

sentences.english: Shark's Lip defrost completely and blanche with ginger water to remove fishiness .
sentences.chinese: 魚脣絲解凍後再以薑片出水，可闢除腥味。

sentences.english: Italian banks are to unfreeze Libyan assets worth more than $500 million.
sentences.chinese: 意大利銀行準備解凍利比亞政府價值五億美元的資產。

sentences.english: I hope this is part of the unfreezing process.
sentences.chinese: 我希望這解凍過程之一。

definition: to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to heat/to add warmth/to raise temperature/fig. to stimulate
to break/to sever/to turn off (electric switch)
